Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋「タフネスガード」
Entry.EnglishText: Armor Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 武器屋「ストレングスウェポン」
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: あなた、この街の ガジュマじゃないわね？
Entry.EnglishText: You're not a Gajuma from here, are you?

Entry.JapaneseText: この辺りは、ひとりで 出歩かないほうがいいわよ。 気をつけなさいね。
Entry.EnglishText: This area can be a bit rough. It's best not to wander around alone, you know. Be careful.

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませー。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 防具を買う 装飾品を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Armor Buy Accessories Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: もう帰るんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, leaving already?
Entry.Notes: weird anomaly here. I did rewrite each of the lines so they sound like something a person would say, but I noticed that the kanji for just this one was different. So I want this double checked.

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの防具を身につければ、 お客様の際立つ魅力も 更に磨きがかかりますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Just wear my armor, and it will make your charms stand out more.

Entry.JapaneseText: お帰りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, leaving already?

Entry.JapaneseText: どの商品もお客様なら とてもお似合いになりますわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, whichever you wear suits you quite fine, dear customer.

Entry.JapaneseText: お帰りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, leaving already?

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサスはもともと、 ヒューマとガジュマの関係が あまり良くなかったけど……
Entry.EnglishText: The relationship between Huma and Gajuma has never been good in Belsas, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、特にひどくなってる ような気がするね…… どうしてかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: Lately, it seems to have worsened. I wonder why it could be...

Entry.JapaneseText: 橋の向こうの地域には、 この街から追い出された ガジュマたちが住んでるの。
Entry.EnglishText: Over on the other side of the bridge, you'll find the Gajuma folks who were forced out of the city living there.

Entry.JapaneseText: 気の毒だとは思うけど…… この街ではスカラベ様の決めた事が すべてだから……
Entry.EnglishText: I do sympathize with them, but you see, in this city, Lord Scarabe's decisions are everything...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの人たち、やっと 話し合いにこぎつけたのね……
Entry.EnglishText: So the Gajuma have finally arranged a discussion...

Entry.JapaneseText: 対立はしてるけど、 根は悪い人たちじゃないから、 良い方向に話が進むといいんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I know there's some hostility, however I know that People are naturally good beings. I hope it ends well...

Entry.JapaneseText: スージーはかわいそうだけど、 スカラベ様がいなくなれば、 少しはこの街も変わるかも しれないわね……
Entry.EnglishText: Although I pity his daughter, Lord Scarabe's absence could bring about real change in this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: スカラベ様はバルカの収容所に 入れられたそうだけど…… 少し頭を冷やすといいわ……
Entry.EnglishText: It appears Lord Scarabe has been confined to Balka's prison. It might do him some good to cool off a little.
Entry.Notes: Not sure if it's a refugee camp or some sort of prison or detention facility.

Entry.JapaneseText: スージーはかわいそうだけど、 スカラベ様がいなくなれば、 少しはこの街も変わるかも しれないわね……
Entry.EnglishText: Although I pity his daughter, Lord Scarabe's absence could bring about real change in this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ジルバ様の演説の後から、 急に防具が売れ出したの……
Entry.EnglishText: My sales suddenly increased after Lady Zilva gave her speech...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの人たちは、 ガジュマの人たちを 恐がってるみたい……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that Huma are afraid of Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: この音、なんだか怖いわ…… 何かが起こった時、 自分を守るのは自分よ……
Entry.EnglishText: This noise... It's a bit unsettling. You know, when push comes to shove, you've got to look out for yourself.

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具を買うなら、今ね。 さあ、見てって……
Entry.EnglishText: Now is the best time to buy some armor. Please, take your time...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私、女王様の演説に ヒントをもらって、お店の キャッチコピーを考えてみたの。
Entry.EnglishText: Her Majesty's speech gave me an inspiration for my shop's next slogan.

Entry.JapaneseText: 階段の壁に貼っておいたから よかったら見てね。
Entry.EnglishText: I've placed it on the wall by the stairs. Please check it out.

Entry.JapaneseText: 一階の人、私の事、 妻だとか言うんです。
Entry.EnglishText: That man downstairs keeps saying I'm his wife...

Entry.JapaneseText: おかしいと思いませんか？ だって、私とあの人、 赤の他人ですもの。
Entry.EnglishText: Don't you think it odd? Why, we're complete strangers.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何なのかしらねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder...

Entry.JapaneseText: おいおい、ガジュマの娘が ウチの店に何の用だ？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, what does a young Gajuma girl need in my shop?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの客が来なくなるから 早いところ出てってくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: You're better get the hell out, because you're scaring away my Huma customers.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……よそ者のガジュマか…… 何か用か……？
Entry.EnglishText: An outsider Gajuma... What do you need?

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃい……
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 武器を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Weapons Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: ……二階は防具屋だ。 ガジュマは、無理に 買わなくてもいいがな……
Entry.EnglishText: Armor shop's on the second floor... Gajuma aren't forced to buy anything though...
Entry.Notes: deepl: ...... upstairs is an armor shop. You don't have to buy anything from Gajuma, though. ......

Entry.JapaneseText: 二階は防具屋だ。 よろしく……
Entry.EnglishText: Armor shop's on the second floor.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何にするんだ……？
Entry.EnglishText: What do you want?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……二階は防具屋だ。 ガジュマは、無理に 買わなくてもいいがな……
Entry.EnglishText: Armor shop's on the second floor... Gajuma aren't forced to buy anything though...

Entry.JapaneseText: 二階は防具屋だ。 よろしく……
Entry.EnglishText: Armor shop's on the second floor.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……こっちも商売だし、 金さえ払ってくれれば、 ガジュマにだって 武器は売るが……
Entry.EnglishText: Well this is a shop, after all... I don't mind selling to Gajuma so long as they have money...

Entry.JapaneseText: 橋の向こうのガジュマどもに 横流しするのだけはやめて くれよな……
Entry.EnglishText: Just make sure not to sell it to those Gajuma across the bridge...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ガジュマと一緒にいるのは あんたの勝手だけど…… ウチの店に長居するのは やめてくれよな。
Entry.EnglishText: Hanging out with Gajuma is your prerogative, but I wouldn't like you to stay here for long.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんた……強そうだな。 ガジュマどもに雇われた 用心棒とかじゃないだろうな？
Entry.EnglishText: You look... strong. You're not some kind of bodyguard hired by those Gajuma, are you?

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近は、ほとんどガジュマ用の 武器は売れないんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: We hardly sell weapons to Gajuma these days...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたの連れてるガジュマ用に いくつか買っていってくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Go buy some for that Gajuma you're with.

Entry.JapaneseText: 兄さん、恋人の前で いいカッコするために 新しい武器はどうだい？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, sir, why not buy yourself some armor so you can look cool in front of your girlfriend?

Entry.JapaneseText: 明日、ヒューマとガジュマの 話し合いがあるらしい。
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently the Huma and Gajuma will be holding a discussion tomorrow.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんた、見かけない顔だが、 そこで何かやらかすために ベルサスに来たんじゃあるまいな？
Entry.EnglishText: Well that's a new face, you didn't come here to cause trouble, did you?

Entry.JapaneseText: 明日の話し合い…… 何事もなきゃいいけどな。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope nothing bad happens in tomorrow's discussion...

Entry.JapaneseText: 万が一にそなえて、 新しい武器を買っちゃあ どうだい？
Entry.EnglishText: Why not buy a new weapon just in case?

Entry.JapaneseText: あんた……女王様を助けてたよな。 将軍とも知り合いみたいだったし、 一体、何者なんだ……？
Entry.EnglishText: You're... the one who saved the Queen, right? You seem to know Commander Milhaust, too... Who are you, exactly?

Entry.JapaneseText: ミルハウスト将軍から お達しがあったよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Commander Milhaust recently gave us some orders...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマを差別するような奴には、 一切武器を売るなってさ…… あんたたちは大丈夫そうだがな。
Entry.EnglishText: He told us not to sell to anyone who discriminates against Gajuma... Well, you guys are fine.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……実を言うとさ、 スカラベ様がいなくなってから、 ガジュマの事も、そんなに いやじゃなくなったんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: ...The truth is, with Lord Scarabe gone, I've started to see the Gajuma in a different light.

Entry.JapaneseText: 雰囲気に流されてたっていうか、 その……失礼な事を言ったかも しれないが、許してくれ……
Entry.EnglishText: I got caught up in the flow... That I-- Uhmm... I might've said some horrible things. Please forgive me.

Entry.JapaneseText: 実を言うと…… 最近、軍の監視も厳しくてさ、 あんまり武器が売れないんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: To be honest... The Army has been increasing its surveillance lately, no one's been coming to buy weapons.

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍の関係者か、あんたたちみたいに よそから来た旅人さんが頼みだよ。 助けると思って何か買ってくれないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, people involved with the military... Hey, since you're outsiders and all, can you guys buy something? Pretty please?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……最近、少しずつだけど ガジュマの事も理解しようと 考えるようになったんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: It's only been a bit, but lately I've been trying to understand Gajuma more...

Entry.JapaneseText: 心に……種族ってのは ないような気がしてさ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've started to feel that... The heart knows no race...

Entry.JapaneseText: 部屋の中にいると いくらかマシだが、 気になる音だな……
Entry.EnglishText: It's way better indoors, but that sound really bothers me...

Entry.JapaneseText: 二階の防具屋にいるのが、 私の妻なんだ。 カワイイ奴だろ？
Entry.EnglishText: The one managing the store upstairs is my wife. Ain't she pretty?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ミートスの鎧（非売品）』 恐るべき力を持った少年戦士が 着ていたという鎧。 とある村の焼け跡から発見された。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Meethos Armor (Not for Sale) - Armor worn by a young knight who possessed a fearsome power. Found in the remnants of a burnt village.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ロニカイルの衣装（非売品）』 その昔、ヘソ出しルックが流行した時代に、 若者たちの間でモテはやされた人気者が 着ていたもの。男用の服だが、丈が短い。 あっと言う間にすたれ、今では誰も着ない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Kyloni Costume (Not for Sale) - Used to be a popular look amongst the youths, this style exposes one's own midriff to the public. Despite the sample targeted towards boys, its wearer seems to be short. It grew out of fashion immediately.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『リューダス・セット（非売品）』 悲劇の戦士リューダスが使ったという 仮面と鎧とマントのセット。 この仮面は、顔が隠れているようで 隠れていないが、なぜか誰も正体に 気づかないという不思議なもの。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Leudas Set (Not for Sale) A set of mask, armor, and mantle used by the tragic hero Leudas. The mask manages to barely hide the face of its user, yet somehow their real identity is hard to find out.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ジョニレイスの衣装（非売品）』 ベルサス出身の吟遊詩人ジョニレイスが 着用していたという帽子と服。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Johnny Ras' Clothing (Not for Sale) - Hat and clothes worn by a minstrel from Belsas named Johnny Ras.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『当店キャッチコピー』 「防具屋タフネスガードの扱う 防具に種族はありません！」 店主
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Store Slogan - "Armor Shop: Tough Guard deals with ARMOR, not RACES!" - Shopkeeper

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『当店キャッチコピー募集中！』 「防具屋タフネスガードにピッタリな フレーズを大募集しちゃいます！ いいものを思いついたらレジまで！」 店主
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Store Tagline Recruitment - "The Armor Shop is currently looking for the perfect tagline! Tell the cash register if you think up something good!" - Shopkeeper

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ジャンニ橋の黄昏』 ベルサスの市街地とスラム街を つなぐ橋の夕景を描いた作品。 この川は、川底がゆるく橋を作るのが 困難だったが、ふたつの種族が 協力してようやく橋ができた。 橋を作った昔の人々は、種族を分ける 橋になろうとは思わなかったはず。
Entry.EnglishText:
<speed:0>- Twilight on Gianni Bridge -
An evening landscape of the bridge that connects Belsas' town and slums. Building a bridge over this river with its loose bed is hard, but with the help of both races, they managed to do it. Those who have built it must have not wanted it to divide both races.
